Key Match Events: Lonzo Ball made his long-awaited return, scoring 10 points in 15 minutes in the Bulls' 125-123 preseason victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Ball nailed an open 3-pointer from the left corner off a feed from Nikola Vucevic with 5:25 left in the first quarter.
Ball also had an assist, a steal, and a block in his first appearance since Jan. 14, 2022.
Post-Match Reflections: Lonzo Ball expressed his feelings about returning to the game, stating, 'It felt a lot better playing than watching.'
Several players expressed their support and respect for Ball in the team's postgame meeting.
Coby White presented the game ball and LaVine handed Ball a jersey that appeared to be signed by the team.
Coach Billy Donovan praised Ball's effort, saying, 'I just give him a lot of credit. It was probably a lot, coming back being out for 2 1/2 years.'
